meanings.definition: To sniff repeatedly, typically because of a cold or crying.
meanings.sent1: She sniffled as she caught a cold.
meanings.sent2: The little girl sniffled when she started crying.
meanings.sent3: The puppy sniffled cutely when it got wet in the rain.
meanings.sent4: The old house sniffled with every gust of wind through its cracks.
meanings.sent5: The student sniffled loudly during the quiet exam.

meanings.definition: To make a sound like a sniffle.
meanings.sent1: He sniffled softly during the sad movie.
meanings.sent2: The kitten sniffled while trying to get the toy out from under the couch.
meanings.sent3: The engine of the car sniffled before finally starting.
meanings.sent4: The leaves on the trees sniffled in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The baby sniffled in his sleep, dreaming peacefully.
